In Syria, the new army confronts the legacy of civil war
subhead: 'Syria after Assad' (4/4). The new volunteer army, structured by the country's transitional authorities, has struggled to integrate the various military factions that have emerged from the conflict during Bashar al-Assad's dictatorship.

title: Fighting rages on Cambodia-Thailand border ahead of expected Trump call
subhead: This week's clashes are the deadliest since five days of fighting in July killed dozens before a shaky truce was agreed, following intervention by Trump. Trump said he expected to speak with the leaders of Thailand and Cambodia to demand a halt to the clashes.

title: French supermarket's veggie wolf Christmas ad goes viral
subhead: Praised for using human actors and animation rather than AI, Intermarché's heartwarming commercial tells the story of a wolf who transforms from fearsome and alone to vegetarian and beloved by all his fellow creatures.

title: The actor and rape accusations behind Brigitte Macron's 'stupid bitches' remark
subhead: France's first lady made headlines with her comments about feminist activists who disrupted a performance of the comedian Ary Abittan. They were contesting the dropping of rape charges against him earlier this year. Le Monde reviewed the ruling and spoke to the plaintiff.

Israel's reign of terror over the West Bank
subhead: Deadly shootings by the army, beatings by settlers, devastating raids, arbitrary arrests, torture in prison: The level of violence inflicted on Palestinians living in the territory has never been so high since the Israeli occupation began in 1967.

title: Trapped by old treaties with Russia, Europeans face threat of heavy financial penalties
subhead: A new report warns of the significant risk facing the European Union due to arbitration proceedings launched by Russian oligarchs and companies targeted by sanctions.

title: The ultra-rich are claiming an increasing share of global wealth
subhead: The wealth of the ultra-rich is undergoing a historic surge, according to the third report of the World Inequality Lab co-directed by French economist Thomas Piketty. Political choices can reverse these trends, the authors say.
